intro: Cephaelis laui, commonly known as the blue poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet petals and is often found in alpine meadows at high altitudes. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is known for its delicate, bell-shaped flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and requires well-drained soil. Due to its rarity and beauty, it is a popular subject in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
